description:
Five years have passed since the occurrence of the incident known as the "Human Annihilation Mission." In Japan, a novelist is dealing with writer's block after her friend has gone missing. In Hong Kong, three sisters, masters in the use of paper, run their own detective agency to solve cases that involve books. When these people are brought together, a bond greater than blood is formed - a bond that will be sorely tested by the evil powers intent on taking over the world.

Join Anita, Maggie, Michelle, and Nenene as they travel the globe in order to save the world from the evil mastermind, Mr. Carpenter! Of course, that's if they can find the time to put down the books they're reading...

(Source: RightStuf)
synonyms: アール・オー・ディー ザ・ティーヴィー

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

name.native: ウェンディ・イアハート
ドレイク・アンダーソン

node.description:
**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bang20140617)
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/ozone_maru) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/users/15639)

Publishes explicit doujinshi under the name "Marumiya."

Eiichi Kamagata serves as president of Lucent Pictures Entertainment, Inc. and co-founder of the newly established animation studio "Lucent 4°C". Previously, he held the position of chief producer and production manager at SPE Visual Works Inc., now known as Aniplex Inc., a joint venture between Sony Pictures Entertainment and Sony Music Entertainment Japan. During his 10 year tenure at Aniplex Inc., he laid the groundwork for animation business and was responsible for overseeing the production process of animated featured films, animated television programs and original video animations.    As a producer, Kamagata has enjoyed the critical acclaim and success of the animated feature film Tekkon Kinkreet and has produced some of the most successful animated television series, including Gurren Lagann, Gintama and D.Gray-man. In addition, he has overseen both the business and creative areas of the animated features of Naruto and Bleach animated television series.
Freelance. Close friends with [Takahiro Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/101403/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大田和寛)

Freelancer with former ties with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) and [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/).

He is known for his sense of timing, which gives his animation often a stop-motion like feeling. He studied as an animator under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/), under whom he often worked on productions like [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) or [You're Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1372/). He does also team up often with animator [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/), who has influenced Matsutake's animation.

Aside of working on anime he has also worked on several games, mostly the Tales of series, where he served as animation supervisor on the animated sequences in most of the series' games.

Also close friends with [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/), [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/).
Notable directorial works include [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/), [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/) and [Magi](https://anilist.co/anime/14513/).

[Website](http://homepage3.nifty.com/YO-SKE/diary.html)

Member of Studio Orphee.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1515331173983330306)

Nishigori graduated from the Toei Animation Institute and joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) as an in-betweener but he rapidly distinguished himself as a key animator. He was inspired to enter the field because he liked [Hidenori Matsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/107672/) and [Takeshi Honda](https://anilist.co/staff/103303/)'s drawings.

His first major role was serving as character animation director for [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/Gunbuster-2-Diebuster/), with the task of adapting [Yoshiyuki Sadamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/98158/Yoshiyuki-Sadamoto)'s character designs for animation. This experience led him to become one of the main character designers at the studio, designing the iconic characters for [Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/).

He left Gainax to have his debut as director on [The Idolm@ster](https://anilist.co/anime/10278/The-Idol-Master/), a personal passion project since he's a great fan of the series. Several Gainax staff followed Nishigori to [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) and worked on the series, alongside staff from newly formed [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/Trigger).

In 2018 he directed his original project [Darling in the Franxx](https://anilist.co/anime/99423/), once again reuniting with his Gainax friends spread among [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/), Trigger and [Studio Khara](https://anilist.co/studio/47/).

More recently he worked as character designer and chief animation director for [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/)'s final Evangelion installment, [Evangelion: 3.0+1.0 Thrice Upon A Time](https://anilist.co/anime/3786/Evangelion-3010-Thrice-Upon-A-Time/).

Shingo Suzuki is an animator previously belonging to Gonzo and Satelight and now affiliated with GoHands.  He was being influenced by Masami Obari and Fumihide Sai and is particularly known for his bold and peculiar shading and high level drawings.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/795583350)

Currently a freelancer with deep ties to [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

He is close friends with [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

Currently a freelancer with deep ties to [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

He is close friends with [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.
